overview_of_class: In this course we will address the role of scientific examination in investigating production and use of art across time and space. The basics of art production out of ceramic, stone, metal, glass, pigments and their binding media will be detailed with the general aim of providing insights into the process of making art; charting the chaîne opératoire from the procurement and processing of raw materials, their trade, and finally how they are formed into a finished object.

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: In this course we will address the role of scientific examination in investigating production and use of art across time and space. The basics of art production out of ceramic, stone, metal, glass, pigments and their binding media will be detailed with the general aim of providing insights into the process of making art; charting the chaîne opératoire from the procurement and processing of raw materials, their trade, and finally how they are formed into a finished object.

descriptions.name: Registration Requirements
descriptions.value: Restricted to Mat Sci and EECS majors. This course cannot count as one of two MSE 300-level technical electives that majors must take, but it can count as a third.

descriptions.name: Evaluation Method
descriptions.value: Class participation accounts for 30% of the grade. Two writing assignments will also be used to assess the students (30%) in addition to a final presentation (40%).

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value: None required. Readings will be made available through Canvas.
